title: "ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)" when trying to create a labeled video
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

When using the GUI under the "Create videos" tab, after selecting the videos and clicking run I get an error in the terminal. A video file is created, but it is not playable. 

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04

### DeepLabCut version

2.2rc3

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

cpu: Intel® Xeon(R) CPU E5-2620 v4 @ 2.10GHz × 32

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell

"""

ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
"""

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

    pool.map(func, Videos)
  File "/home/flybot/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 364, in map
    return self._map_async(func, iterable, mapstar, chunksize).get()
  File "/home/flybot/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 771, in get

ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
```
